description.p: Occultists study monsters, and the planes they hail from. They could be Archeologists, Monster Hunters, or even Cult Fanatics. There are currently 3 Fields of Study of the Occult: Demonology, Psionogy, and Mythology. Demonologists study the lower planes: from the chaotic denizens of the Abyss, to the rigid cast systems of the Nine hells. Psionocists study cosmic horrors, specializing in Aberrations and focusing their study on places like The Astral Plane or The Far Realm. Mythologists specialize in mythical creatures, with a focus on Fey and the elemental forces of nature.

Any who research the occult are warped by its study, adopting traits of the very creatures they seek to understand. Occultists learn to draw on magical power the same way monsters do: through innate affinity. Spells known by Occultists become a part of them, leaving them with no need for spell slots.

div.p: This class mimics a full caster, but lacks spell slots. As you gain levels in this class, you will gain spells you can cast a certain number of times per day. The spell progression mirrors that of an Eldritch Knight or an Arcane Trickster, but you will have far more castings of the limited spells you know. The theme here is monster features. You will gain access to a number of traits found exclusively on monster stat blocks, for example: an AOE that recharges on a d6 roll. This class also has interesting synergy with spellcasting racial traits. Try it out, and tell me what you think!

description.p: As an occultist, you gain the following class features.

ul.li: Hit Points at 1st Level: 6 + your Constitution modifier
Hit Points at Higher Levels: 1d6 (or 3) + your Constitution modifier per occultist level after 1st
Skills: Choose two from Arcana, History, Nature, Intimidation, Persuasion, Medicine, Insight, or Animal handling

description.p: You start with the following equipment, in addition to the equipment granted by your background:

ul.li: (a) a light crossbow and 20 bolts or (b) any simple weapon
(a) an Explorer's pack or (b) a Scholar's pack
(a) a component pouch or (b) an arcane focus
Leather armor, any simple weapon, and 1 research notebook

description.p: Your research into the extraplanar has given you insight into the methods non-humanoids use to produce magical effects. See chapter 10 in the Players Handbook for the general rules on spellcasting.
Your spell list, as well as your spellcasting ability modifier, is determined by your Field of Study, which you choose at 1st level.

div.p: Spell Save DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your ability score modifier
Spell attack modifier = your proficiency bonus + your ability score modifier

description.p: At 1st level, you know three cantrips from the spell list of your Field of Study. You learn one more cantrip at 10th level.
Through your study of monsters, you have unlocked your latent magical potential.

As you gain levels in this class, you will uncover new spells, which you can cast without expending spell slots. Spells known by Occultists are a part of their very being, and as such, they are unable to change them.
At 1st level, you know two spells of 1st level from your Field of Studies spell list, which you can cast 1/day each without expending a spell slot.
You gain two spells of 2nd level when you reach 6th level, two spells of 3rd level when you reach 13th level, and two spells of 4th level when you reach 18th level.

sheet.description: You can cast your Innate Affinity spells 1/day each wihtou expending a spell slot.

description.p: Through the process of unlocking your innate spellcasting abilities, you have learned to quickly harness and store magic from the world around you.
At 1st level, after you finish a short rest, if you have any expended spells that can be cast 1/day without spell slots, their uses are restored.
This does not extend to spells that have more than 1 use per day. You cannot use this feature again until you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: After you finish a short rest, if you have any expended spells that can be cast 1/day without spell slots, their uses are restored. This does not extend to spells that have more than 1 use per day.

description.p: When someone ventures into the realm of the occult, they are seeking lore on specific creatures and places. Perhaps they seek the true name of an Archdevil so they can conduct some dastardly deal, or maybe they have been captivated by the beauty of the Fey, and simply wish to learn more about them.

Regardless of the reason, the path of the Occultist is paved with rigorous study and explicit danger. The subjects of their research are more often than not deadly, and the alien territory they dwell in is no less so.
When you choose this class at 1st level, you select one of the following Fields of Study to be your specialty.
Unlocking your latent magical potential has caused energies from all the mltiverse to funnel into you, like a great cosmic stream.

At 2nd level, you can deal 2d6 damage in a 15-foot cone as an action. Creatures in the area make Dexterity saves against your spell save DC, taking half damage on a success. The damage type is determined by your Field of Study when you gain this feature. (It cannot be changed).
This damage increases as you gain levels in this class, as depicted on the Occultist table.

At the start of each of your turns after this ability has been expended, roll 1d6. On a result of 6, this ability can be used again, otherwise, you must finish a short or long rest before using this ability again.

sheet.description: Recharge: 6. You can deal {{font-of-mana:damage-dice}}d6 {{font-of-mana:damage-type}} damage in a {{font-of-mana:range}}-foot cone. Creatures in the area make Dexterity saves against your spell save DC, taking half damage on a success.

Recharge: 5-6. You can deal {{font-of-mana:damage-dice}}d6 {{font-of-mana:damage-type}} damage in a {{font-of-mana:range}}-foot cone. Creatures in the area make Dexterity saves against your spell save DC, taking half damage on a success.

Recharge: 4-6. You can deal {{font-of-mana:damage-dice}}d6 {{font-of-mana:damage-type}} damage in a {{font-of-mana:range}}-foot cone or a 5-foot wide, 120-foot long beam. Creatures in the area make Dexterity saves against your spell save DC, taking half damage on a success.

description.p: Your careful study allows you to top off your knowledge of the eldritch with additional spells.
At 3rd level, you learn one spell of 1st level from your Field of Studies spell list, which you can cast 1/day without expending a spell slot.
You learn one 2nd level spell at 9th level, and one 3rd level spell at 15th level.

sheet.description: You can cast your Expanded Affinity spells once per day.

description.p: You can channel the excess power from your Font of Mana into certain spells, which you have so keenly engraved in your memory that casting them is as simple as breathing.
At 3rd level, you learn one spell of 1st level from your Field of Studies spell list, which you can cast at-will, without expending a spell slot.
You learn one 2nd level spell at 10th level, and one 3rd level spell at 20th level.

sheet.description: You can cast your Favored Spells at will.

description.p: When you reach 4th, 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1 each.
The ocean of cosmic energy you channel has made casting your lesser spells trivial for you.

At 5th level, spells of 1st level which you can only cast 1/day, can now be cast 3/day. (This extends to Innate Spellcasting abilities obtained through Racial Traits, Magic Initiate, and other means.)

sheet.description: Spells of 1st level which you can only cast 1/day, can now be cast 3/day.

description.p: Your familiarity with certain spells allows you to fire them off quickly.
At 5th level, if you have not already used one this turn, you can cast one of your Favored Spells as a bonus action.
You can do this a number of times equal to your spellcasting ability modifier, and you regain all expended uses after a long rest.

sheet.description: You can cast one of your Favored Spells as a bonus action.

description.p: The power flowing through you has become even more wild, overwhelming you with energy.
At 6th level, your Font of Mana now extends to 30ft, and recharges on a d6 roll of 5-6.
As you gain levels in this class, the endless Font of Mana pumping through you spills out into your spellcasting.
At 7th level, when you cast a spell of 1st level that is capable of being upcast, and you did not expend a spell slot, it is upcast to second level.
At 15th level, when you cast a spell of 2nd level that is capable of being upcast, and you did not expend a spell slot, it is upcast to third level.

sheet.description: When you cast a spell of 1st level that is capable of being upcast, and you did not expend a spell slot, it is upcast to second level.

When you cast a spell of 1st level that is capable of being upcast, and you did not expend a spell slot, it is upcast to second level. When you cast a spell of 2nd level that is capable of being upcast, and you did not expend a spell slot, it is upcast to third level.

description.p: Your time spent studying extraplanar beings has taught you to notice certain traits about other creatures after a moment of observation.

At 7th level, you can spend 1 minute examining another creature to determine certain characteristics about it. You make a check with your spellcasting ability modifier against a DC of 10 or the creatures CR (whichever is higher). On a success, you learn one of the following:

ul.li: (b) its classes, and how many levels it has in each
(c) its creature name, creature type, and allignment

description.p: You can use this feature a number of times equal to your spellcasting ability modifier, and regain any expended uses after a long rest. Once you use this feature on a creature, you cannot use it on the same creature again for 24 hours.

sheet.description: You can spend 1 minute examining another creature to determine certain characteristics about it. You make a check with your spellcasting ability modifier against a DC of 10 or the creatures CR (whichever is higher). On a success, you learn one of the following: its damage immunities and resistances; its classes, and how many levels it has in each; or its creature name, creature type, and allignment. Once you use this feature on a creature, you cannot use it on the same creature again for 24 hours.

description.p: The energy constantly seeping from your being hangs heavily on you, warding you from other magics.
At 11th level, you have advantage on saving throws made to resist spells, and other magical effects.
If you fail a saving throw against a spell or other magical effect, you lose this trait until you finish a short or long rest.
At 20th level, you no longer lose this trait when you fail saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

sheet.description: You have advantage on saving throws made to resist spells, and other magical effects. If you fail a saving throw against a spell or other magical effect, you lose this trait until you finish a short or long rest.
You have advantage on saving throws made to resist spells, and other magical effects.

description.p: Through your study of powerful, extraplanar entities, you have learned to see reality as they do, if only for a moment.
At 13th level, you can give yourself True Sight out to 30 feet.
This effect persists for 1 minute. Once you use this feature, you must complete a long rest before you can use it again.

sheet.description: You can give yourself True Sight out to 30 feet for 1 minute.

description.p: The energy of the multiverse weighs on you like a great flood, threatening to swollow everything around you.
At 17th level, your Font of Mana feature now extends out to 60ft.
You have gained complete control of the flood, and can release the endless ocean with ease.
At 20th level, your Font of Mana feature recharges on a d6 roll of 4-6, and can be shaped into a 5ft wide, 120ft long beam, instead of a cone.

Demonology focuses on the Lower Planes, and the hellish creatures that lurk there. Those who choose this area of study spend so much time around negative energies that their souls begin to adopt the properties of them.
You take your spells from the Warlock spell list, and your spellcasting ability modifier is Charisma.
When you gain your Font of Mana feature at 2nd level, select one damage type from Necrotic, Fire, or Poison.
At 1st level, you learn ether Infernal or Abyssal. You gain Darkvision 120ft, and you are proficient in Deception.

Your devilish guile allows you to make your deadliest spells even more potent. At 1st level, you can add your Charisma modifier to one of the damage rolls of a cantrip or spell cast without expending a spell slot, that you cast on your turn.

sheet.description: You can add {{charisma:modifier}} to one of the damage rolls of a cantrip or spell cast without expending a spell slot, that you cast on your turn.

description.p: Your study has uncovered a sliver of fiendish magic.
At 1st level, you can cast ray of sickness 1/day without expending a spell slot.

sheet.description: You can cast ray of sickness without expending a spell slot.

description.p: The nightmarish mark your study has left on your soul is apparent for all the world to see.

At 6th level, you can frighten creatures within 15 feet of you as an action, forcing them to make a Wisdom saving against your spell save DC. Creatures frightened in this way spend their movement on their turn running away from you. A creature that is 15 feet away from you can repeat this save at the end of each of their turns, ending this effect on a success.
You can do this a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier, and regain expended uses on a long rest.

sheet.description: You can frighten creatures within 15 feet of you as an action, forcing them to make a Wisdom saving against your spell save DC. Creatures frightened in this way spend their movement on their turn running away from you. A creature that is 15 feet away from you can repeat this save at the end of each of their turns, ending this effect on a success.

description.p: You have discovered even greater magic from the lower planes.
At 6th level, you can cast scorching ray 3/day without expending a spell slot.

sheet.description: You can cast scorching ray without expending a spell slot.

description.p: Prolonged exposure to Demons and Devils has caused your body to adopt some of their resilience.
At 10th level, you are resistant to Fire, Lightning, and either Cold or Poison damage.
Your research has revealed the methods fiends use to summon each other from their home planes.
At 14th level, You can use an action to attempt to magically summon a Fiend from one of the Lower Planes.

Make a Charisma check against 11 + the target creatures CR. On a success, the creature appears in an unoccupied space within 30 feet of you. If a creature has a CR lower then 1, you round the DC up to 12 and summon however many of that creature it takes to make a CR 1, (so 4 CR 1/4, or 8 CR 1/8).

You can summon creatures of a CR equal to your level in this class divided by 3. A summoned fiend appears in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of its summoner, acts as an ally of its summoner, and can't summon other creatures.
It remains for 1 minute, until you or it dies, or until you dismiss it as an action. Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: You can magically summon a Fiend from one of the lower places by making a Charisma check against 11 + the target creatures CR. On a success, the creature appears in an unoccupied space within 30 feet of you. If a creature has a CR lower then 1, you round the DC up to 12 and summon however many of that creature it takes to make a CR 1, (so 4 CR 1/4, or 8 CR 1/8). You can summon creatures of a CR equal to your level in this class divided by 3. A summoned fiend appears in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of its summoner, acts as an ally of its summoner, and can't summon other creatures. It remains for 1 minute, until you or it dies, or until you dismiss it as an action.

description.p: Psionocists focus their study beyond the outer planes. They seek ancient, eldritch lore that has been forgotten to the eons by all but the oldest and most alien beings.

The nature of their research causes them to study the mind, and the alternate pathways one can use to generate thought. Through this study, they learn to awaken their minds eye, allowing them to create a number of Psionic affects.
You take your spells from the Sorcerer spell list, and your spellcasting ability modifier is Intelligence.
When you gain your Font of Mana feature at 2nd level, select one damage type from Psychic, Force, or Radiant.
At 1st level, you have telepathy out to 60 feet. You also know Deep Speech, and are proficient with Investigation.

sheet.description: You have telepathy out to 60 feet.

description.p: Your influence over the minds of others is exceptionally hard to break.
At 1st level, you can impose disadvantage on a check or save made by a creature that is charmed or frightened of you, as a reaction.
You can do this a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier, and regain expended uses on a long rest.

sheet.description: You can impose disadvantage on a check or save made by a creature that is charmed or frightened of you.

description.p: Your study has given you insight into the inner workings of the mind.
At 1st level, you can cast charm person 1/day without expending a spell slot.

sheet.description: You can cast charm person without expending a spell slot.

description.p: The reach of your minds eye is so vast that other creatures find it difficult to shield information from you.

At 6th level, once per turn, when you communicate telepathically with another creature, you can ask it a question and force it to make a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC. On a fail, you learn the answer to that question, regardless of its response.

The creature must know the answer to your question for you to receive your answer. Pass or fail, the creature is unaware that you probed its thoughts unless it also has telepathy. Creatures with telepathy make this saving throw with advantage.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier, and regain expended uses after a long rest.

sheet.description: Once per turn, when you communicate telepathically with another creature, you can ask it a question and force it to make a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC. On a fail, you learn the answer to that question, regardless of its response. The creature must know the answer to your question for you to receive your answer. Pass or fail, the creature is unaware that you probed its thoughts unless it also has telepathy. Creatures with telepathy make this saving throw with advantage.

description.p: Your study has uncovered even greater insight into the eldritch.
At 6th level, you can cast levitate 3/day without expending a spell slot.

sheet.description: You can cast levitate without expending a spell slot.

description.p: The mental exercises you train yourself with have sharpened your mind. Your willpower is far beyond that of a normal humanoid.

At 10th level, you are resistant to Psychic damage. Creatures charmed by you regard you as a trusted friend to be heeded and protected. Although the target isn't under your control, it takes your requests or actions in the most favorable way it can.
Creatures frightened of you take psychic damage equal to your Intelligence modifier while within 30 feet of you at the start of each of their turns.

sheet.description: Creatures charmed by you regard you as a trusted friend to be heeded and protected. Although the target isn't under your control, it takes your requests or actions in the most favorable way it can. Creatures frightened of you take {{intelligence:modifier}} psychic damage while within 30 feet of you at the start of each of their turns.

description.p: So sharp is your minds eye, that you can will physical things to move.
At 14th level, you learn the mage hand cantrip, which conjures an invisible hand when you cast it.

You can use your action to force 1 creature within 30 feet of you to contest their Strength with your Intelligence. On a fail, the creature is ether moved a number of feet equal to 5x your Intelligence modifier in a direction you choose, or knocked prone.
You cannot use this feature if your concentration is being demanded elsewhere. (For example: when you are concentrating on a spell.)

sheet.description: You can use your action to force 1 creature within 30 feet of you to contest their Strength with your Intelligence. On a fail, the creature is ether moved {{minor-telekinesis:range}} feet in a direction you choose, or knocked prone. You cannot use this feature if your concentration is being demanded elsewhere.

description.p: Mythology focuses on the study of nature, and its connection to magic. It is not uncommon to meet mythologists who study Monstrosities, like Griffons or Manticores, but more often then not, their study revolves around the Feywild and the Inner Planes.

Mythologists acclimate themselves to the magic of the natural world by exposing themselves to it. As such, they learn to not only resist its more harmful effects, but to commune, and become one with it.
You take your spells from the Druid spell list, and your spellcasting ability modifier is Wisdom.
When you gain your Font of Mana feature at 2nd level, select one damage type from Fire, Lightning, or Cold.
At 1st level, you learn ether Sylvan or Primordial. You can also speak with beasts and plants as if you shared a language, and you are proficient with Survival.

sheet.description: You can speak with beasts and plants as if you shared a language.

description.p: The soft, colorful light of the Feywild emanates from you, like a faintly shimmering veil of mist.

At 1st level, you gain a pool of d6’s equal to your level in this class, that you can use to heal others. As an action, you can heal one creature within 60 feet of you with a number of dice from the pool, up to your Wisdom modifier. These dice are replenished after a long rest.

sheet.description: You have a pool of {{level:occultist}} d6’s that you can use to heal others. As an action, you can heal one creature within 60 feet of you with up to {{faerie-light:dice-limit}} dice from the pool.

description.p: Your study has given you a degree of control over nature.
At 1st level, you can cast entangle 1/day without expending a spell slot. It does not require concentration when cast in this way.

sheet.description: You can cast entangle without expending a spell slot. It does not require concentration when cast in this way.

description.p: Your time spent analyzing Druids and the Fey have given you the ability to feel out the pathways they use to travel.

At 6th level, you can expend 10 feet of movement on your turn to enter a living plant of medium size or larger. You exit from another plant of medium size or larger within 60 feet, reappearing within 5 feet of it.
You can use this ability only once per turn.

sheet.description: You can expend 10 feet of movement on your turn to enter a living plant of medium size or larger. You exit from another plant of medium size or larger within 60 feet, reappearing within 5 feet of it.

description.p: Communing with nature has revealed even greater magic to you.
At 6th level, you can cast invisibility 3/day without expending a spell slot.

sheet.description: You can cast invisibility without expending a spell slot.

description.p: Exposure to the raw forces of nature have left you able to resist some of its more harmful effects.
At 10th level, you have advantage on saving throws made to resist being Charmed or Frightened.
You can also expend 2 dice from your Faerie Light feature's pool as an action to cure one condition or disease effecting a creature you touch.

sheet.description: You have advantage on saving throws made to resist being Charmed or Frightened. You can also expend 2 dice from your Faerie Light feature's pool as an action to cure one condition or disease effecting a creature you touch.

description.p: You have become so in tune with nature that the land itself allows you safe passage.
At 14th level, you gain a burrow speed of 30 feet. You can burrow through nonmagical, unworked earth and stone. While doing so, you dont disturb the material you move through.
You cannot end your turn inside earth or stone.

sheet.description: You can burrow through nonmagical, unworked earth and stone. While doing so, you dont disturb the material you move through. You cannot end your turn inside earth or stone.
